question: What is one action students can take with aluminum cans at school to help conserve natural resources?

content.source_1: At Greendale Middle School, recycling items made from natural resources helps conserve those resources by reducing the need to extract new raw materials.
content.source_2: Aluminum is a metal extracted from bauxite ore.
content.source_3: Beverage cans are commonly made of aluminum.
content.source_4: Metals such as aluminum are natural resources obtained from the Earth.
content.source_5: Greendale Middle School bans aluminum beverage cans on campus; the cafeteria and vending machines provide only cartons or refillable containers.
content.source_6: Greendale’s recycling stations do not collect aluminum; the school’s program accepts only paper and #1–2 plastics.
